Title: Creating healing environment in cancer rehabilitation centre: A comparison study
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ismalia, R., Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Djimantoro, M.I., Architecture Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Cancer is a deadly disease that continues to increase in the number of sufferers over time. Most patients not only have pain in their body, but also anxiety and depression, and physical fatigue. Therefore, the process of handling cancer must be comprehensive, both from physical and mental and psychological care with the Optimal Healing Environment (OHE) approach. The OHE concept needs to be applied not only in cancer-specific hospitals, but also needs to be applied in comprehensive cancer care facilities to relieve patient pain, fatigue and weakness. This study aims to examine the variable of healing environment applied in Cancer Rehabilitation Center Project. The method used in this research is a comparative study method with qualitative discussion. The results can define the principles parameters of healing environment in cancer rehabilitation design. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
